question: Which topoisomerase is essential in yeast?
ideal_answer: Eukaryotic DNA topoisomerase II is an abundant nuclear enzyme that is essential for cell proliferation. Yeast DNA topoisomerase II is encoded by a single-copy, essential gene.

snippets.text: Yeast DNA topoisomerase II is encoded by a single-copy, essential gene.
Disruption of one copy of the gene in a diploid yeast creates a recessive lethal mutation, indicating that the single DNA topoisomerase II gene of yeast has an essential function.
